intro: Sida blepharoprion, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy surface, while its flowers are small and clustered. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
